{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3164858,"name":"Jackson Elia","username":"Traptricker","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/traptricker/{size}/215403_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-15T00:20:22.657Z","cooked":"

Hello,

My team is using 2 limelight 3s this year. Both of them and our radio are plugged into our ethernet switch which then plugs into our roborio 2.0. When the limelights are disconnected (I unplug them from the switch), wireless comms work fine. But when I plug them in, comms become pretty unresponsive, continuously connecting then disconnecting. How do I fix this?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2023-03-15T00:20:22.657Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":25,"reads":104,"readers_count":103,"score":145.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":430313,"topic_slug":"limelight-3s-crashing-comms","display_username":"Jackson Elia","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53032,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4829 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/limelight-3s-crashing-comms/430313/1","custom_user_title":"4829 Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3164875,"name":"mrwright","username":"mrwright","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mrwright/{size}/135982_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-15T01:08:46.601Z","cooked":"

Following. We have had the same issue recently. When we plug in two limelights we lose comms and the lights around the Ethernet cable at the robo rio shut off. When we unplug one of the limelights, the issue goes away.

might this be caused by both limelights wanting the same ip and causing the network to crash because of this? or maybe sending network tables data by the same name?

Have you tried setting static ip on both of them? That might fix it.

one of them doesn’t have a static IP, how do I set it?

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2023-03-15T02:48:03.827Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":67,"readers_count":66,"score":13.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":430313,"topic_slug":"limelight-3s-crashing-comms","display_username":"Jackson Elia","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":51921,"username":"SammyPants","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sammypants/{size}/188763_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53032,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4829 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/limelight-3s-crashing-comms/430313/6","custom_user_title":"4829 Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3164978,"name":"Joe Witcpalek","username":"wits","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/wits/{size}/110752_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-15T02:59:23.268Z","cooked":"

Don’t know the issue and the suggestions already provided would be what I would check.

Really wanted to comment that this is the setup we are using and it is working. We’ve set up static IP addresses on both limelights with unique network tables. Also when we are debugging we can get a lot of other information in network tables …

Other things to check are do you have the latest limelight image (there were a bunch of fixes that happened right before week 1). I’d also try replacing swapping out things one at a time like the switch, ethernet cables, etc. to see if that helps

The issue was that we were feeding our switch 12 V when it needed 5 V
